alert.note: Alert for Essex; Franklin (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 11:56PM EST until February 18 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New York, including the following counties, Essex, Franklin and St. Lawrence. * WHEN...Until 545 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Depending on ice behavior, any release of the ice jam could result in sudden rises of water, leading to a rapid flooding situation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1153 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Canton, Tupper Lake, Gouverneur, Adirondack Regional Airport, Saranac Lake, Oswegatchie, De Kalb, Fowler, Colton, Piercefield, Cranberry Lake, Carry Falls Reservoir, Degrasse, Star Lake, Horseshoe Lake, Hermon, Rensselaer Falls, Richville, Wawbeek and Heuvelton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
